Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.SerialNumber
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SerialNumber
Parameter.Help: The serial number reported from the device. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.PeriodicInterval
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: PeriodicInterval
Parameter.Help: Number of seconds from the last provisioning to the next provisioning. The parameter is populated on every provisioning of the device. This is a read-only parameter, to change the value, look at the system parameters Frequency and Spread.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.PublicIPAddress
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: PublicIPAddress
Parameter.Help: Public IP address of the device. The device is not necessarily reachable on this address, since it could be behind a NAT-gateway. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Device.SoftwareVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SoftwareVersion
Parameter.Help: Software version of the device as registered on the last provisioning. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.FirstConnectTms
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: FirstConnectTms
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the timestamp of the first contact between the server and the device. It doesn't necessarily mean that there has been a successful provisioning. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.LastConnectTms
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: LastConnectTms
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the timestamp of the latest contact between the server and the device. It doesn't necessarily mean that there has been a successful provisioning. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Secret
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Secret
Parameter.Help: The secret which authorizes the provisioning session. Changing this value may easily disrupt provisioning.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Debug
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Debug
Parameter.Help: If set to "1", TR-069 conversation log will be dumped into fusion-tr069-debug.log. Default is "0".

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.DesiredSoftwareVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: DesiredSoftwareVersion
Parameter.Help: Set the desired software version, to initiate a firmware upgrade/downgrade. Simply specify the version of the software file (found in Files-section).

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.IM.Message
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Message
Parameter.Help: May contain information from STUN server regarding kick operation. This is a read-only parameter.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.Current
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.Current
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the ongoing job id for this unit. This is a read-only parameter. Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.Disruptive
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.Disruptive
Parameter.Help: If set to "1" the parameter indicates that a job in this job chain is disruptive, hence all sub-sequent jobs must run regardless of servicewindow restrictions. Default is "0". Internal usage.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Job.History
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Job.History
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the job history of the unit. The format is (,job-id:repeat-counter:last-run-tms)*. Internal usage mainly, but one can delete certain jobs from the history to re-run a job.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ProvisioningMode
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: ProvisioningMode
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the provisioning mode. The default mode is "REGULAR". The other option is "READALL" used to retrieve all parameters from the device. Usually set by using the buttons on the top of the Unit Configuration Page.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Restart
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Restart
Parameter.Help: Set to "1" to trigger a restart of the device. As soon as the restart has been provisioned, the parameter is set to "0", which is default.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Reset
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Restart
Parameter.Help: Set to "1" to trigger a factory reset of the device. As soon as the reset has been provisioned, the parameter is set to "0", which is default.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.SecretScheme
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SecretScheme
Parameter.Help: The parameter is only used in TFTP and HTTP provisioning. If set to "ENCRYPTED" the provisioning will be encrypted.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Disruptive
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Disruptive
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the regular service window. Default is blank (interpreted as mo-su:0000-2400). The service window format is weekday-weekday:hour-hour, an example are mo-fr:0800-1500.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Enable
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Enable
Parameter.Help: If set to "0", service window is not enabled. Default is blank (interpreted as "1").

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Frequency
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Frequency
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains the number of provisionings pr week. Default is blank (interpreted as 7).

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Regular
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Regular
Parameter.Help: The parameter defines the regular service window. Default is blank (interpreted as mo-su:0000-2400). The service window format is weekday-weekday:hour-hour, an example are mo-fr:0800-1500.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.ServiceWindow.Spread
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Spread
Parameter.Help: The parameter contains a spread-factor (default is blank (interpreted as 50) which tells how many percent the randomization of the spread will be. If set to 0, no spreading of the periodic inform interval will occur.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.SoftwareURL
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: SoftwareURL
Parameter.Help: This parameter can be used to specify an optional URL for firmware download. By default the system will handle a download without usage of this parameter, but if you want to download from some other location than the system, or if the device doens't handle the auto-generated URL from the system, then this parameter can be set in conjunction with DesiredSoftwareVersion.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Telnet.IPAddress
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Telnet.IPAddress
Parameter.Help: The IP address of the device you want to execute a telnet-script on. It must be a public IP address.

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Telnet.Port
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Telnet.Port
Parameter.Help: The TCP port on which you want to execute a telnet-script on. Defaults to 23 (standard Telnet port)

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Telnet.Username
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Telnet.Username
Parameter.Help: The username to use in Telnet-login

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Telnet.Password
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Telnet.Password
Parameter.Help: The password to use in Telnet-login

Parameter.Name: System.X_OWERA-COM.Telnet.DesiredScriptVersion
Parameter.Heading: System parameter: Telnet.DesiredScriptVersion
Parameter.Help: The TELNET script file version that you want to execute. Such a Telnet script execution can only be done using a Job (Telnet-job) in the Jobs section.
